bug.author: cottrell
bug.summary: tf.summary.tensor_summary no longer appears in the REPL, see it in the code? Docs need update?
bug.description: Not sure what the intention is as I see a lot of v1/v2 name changing. tf.summary.scalar is there but not tf.summary.tensor_summary In [80]: tf.version Out[80]: '2.0.0-alpha0'

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/cottrell>@cottrell</denchmark-link> Can you please provide the doc link which needs to be updated. Thanks!

I am not finding a "deprecated" notices here for example: <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/summary/tensor_summary>https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/summary/tensor_summary</denchmark-link>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/cottrell>@cottrell</denchmark-link> is part of version only and it will stay with TF1.x. I think there is no need for deprecation warning. For example, <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r1.14/api_docs/python/tf/Session>tf.session</denchmark-link> is part of only and hence there is no deprecation warning. Please let us know what you think. Please close this issue if it was resolved. Thanks!
It has been 14 days with no activity and the awaiting response label was assigned. Is this still an issue?
Closing due to lack of recent activity. Please update the issue when new information becomes available, and we will reopen the issue. Thanks!
